footer: Contact info - Email: ysuo85@gmail.com

components.content: My name is Ian Suo. I am a veteran and came back to Stony Brook University starting this semester. My major is Computer Science with a minor in Technical Systems Management. With this degree, I plan on coding and maintaining system infrastructures, be it financial systems, distributed systems, or embedded systems, if it runs a machine, I want to touch it. But I have to start somewhere, so I'm in the process of applying for the part-time position of Technical Student Lead at DoIT next semester. If I get the job, I get to maintain and reimage operating systems used by researchers on campus and assist them with various projects involved with Arduino. This will be an interesting job.

My class schedule next semester is going to be: CSE 220, AMS 310, CHE 132, and EST 325. In CSE 220 I will be learning about operating system fundamentals, AMS 310 is probability theory, CHE 132 is general chemistry, and EST 325 is technology at workplace.

While I was in the military, I was an F-18 mechanic. I did one deployment to Japan, soon after that, I joined the F-35B project and had the opportunity to work with some very motivated leaders to test and maintain the aircrafts in the first F-35B squadron in the Marine Corps. I've always liked software. When I realized a lot of the mechanical aircraft controls were phased out and replaced by softwares, I decided it's a good time to go back to school and pursue my passion to program these brains that is capable to command all sorts of machinery.
